actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-67.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 30.
Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the twelfth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

summary.text: Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a public event, the 12th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 1993.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the twelfth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.
